definition: to sting or bite (of mosquito, bee etc)/to say repeatedly/to urge insistently/to ask repeatedly/to stick to a point/(onom.) tinkling or jingling sound
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
fourth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/fourth in order/letter "D" or Roman "IV" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/ancient Chinese compass point: 195°/butyl/cubes (of food)
to warn repeatedly/to urge/to exhort again and again
to warn/to urge/to exhort/to give instructions carefully and insistently
repeatedly urging/imploring over and over again
lit. flies do not attack an intact egg (idiom)/fig. no smoke without a fire
pinyin: cang1 ying5 bu4 ding1 wu2 feng4 dan4

definition: lit. if you tap a half-empty bottle it makes a sound (idiom)/fig. empty vessels make the most noise/one who has a little knowledge likes to show off, but one who is truly knowledgeable is modest
pinyin: ban4 ping2 shui3 xiang3 ding1 dang1

definition: to question closely/to make a detailed inquiry/to probe/to ask repeatedly

sentences.english: Even when I climbed carefully into my hammock, about 30 would zip under the net.
sentences.chinese: 即使當我小心爬進我的吊牀時，我仍被叮了約30次。

sentences.english: Through the grass came a soft silvery tinkling.
sentences.chinese: 從草海中傳來了一陣微弱的銀叮鈴聲。

sentences.english: It is those people who are most likely to be bitten.
sentences.chinese: 那些就是最可能被蚊子叮的人。

sentences.english: Eg. The red spot on his arm is a sting.
sentences.chinese: 他胳膊上的小紅點是蟲叮的傷痕。

sentences.english: Put this lotion on the insect gnaws to stop them hurting.
sentences.chinese: 在蟲子叮的場地抹點這種水兒止痛。

sentences.english: Injuries the gate not to bite sutures or the wrap.
Can I get infected with HIV from mosquitoes?By Mark Cichocki, R. N.
sentences.chinese: 我被蚊子叮了，會得艾滋病嗎？

sentences.english: A bumble-bee stung one, and then there were five.
sentences.chinese: 一隻大黃蜂叮了一個，還剩五個。

sentences.english: He got stung by a wasp while cutting grass and his face is swollen now.
sentences.chinese: 在割草時，他被黃蜂叮了下，現在臉都腫了。

sentences.english: One caboodle is being swung to go after his schoolgirl when he encounters Ding Ding.
sentences.chinese: 他遇見丁叮的時候正在甩掉一堆追求他的女生。

sentences.english: The fatal infection begins with the bite of a tsetse fly.
sentences.chinese: 昏睡症的致命感染始於采采蠅的一叮。

sentences.english: He seemed to have no objection to stings.
sentences.chinese: 傑克遜先生看來絲毫不在意野蜂的叮刺。

sentences.english: A pensioner has died after he was stung by a bee during a picnic.
sentences.chinese: 一位老人在野餐時被野蜂叮了後就去世了。

sentences.english: I reached up and caught it, and it stung me.
sentences.chinese: 我不信邪，一伸手就給抓住了，然後被叮了一下。

definition: (onom.) scraping sound/ripping of fabric/screeching of tires
(onom.) breaking or snapping/(coll.) cut it out/stop it/also written 喀嚓[ka1 cha1]
(onom.) to squeak (of mice)/to chirp or peep (of small birds)
